problem_text:
For relatively free groups G, prove or disprove the following conjecture of P. Hall: if a word v takes only finitely many values on G then the verbal subgroup vG is finite.
S. V. Ivanov
answer: The conjecture is disproved (A. Storozhev, Proc. Amer. Math. Soc., 124, no. 10 (1996), 2953–2954).
